  • Development »

Core¶

maker is at the heart of the project. It provides a set of generic models, such as Object, which is extended by many other entities in Maker.

The Core also handles automatic module insertion and provides many routines for module manipulation.

Models¶

maker Core system objects

class maker.core.models.IntegrationResource(nuvius_id, resource_id, resource_name, services='', role='slave')[source]¶

Resource set for integration via Nuvius

nuvius_id = <ID of the user on Nuvius (may be obtained via JSONP call> resource_id = <Application ID, i.e. 1 for Facebook> resource_name = <Application name, i.e. Google Contacts> services = <Data points ID on Nuvius, e.g. for /services/news/ ID is 37rw to read/write> role = <Usually master or slave>

nuvius_id = 0¶
resource_id = 0¶
resource_name = ''¶
role = 'slave'¶
service = ''¶

class maker.core.conf.Settings[source]¶

Bases: django.conf.LazySettings

A lazy proxy for either global Django settings or a custom settings object. The user can manually configure settings prior to using them. Otherwise, Django uses the settings module pointed to by DJANGO_SETTINGS_MODULE.

class maker.core.mail.EmailReceiver(server_type, server_name, username, password, folder_name=None)[source]¶

Bases: threading.Thread

EmailReceiver fetches email from imap and pop email servers. This class can be used only as parent. You should redefine the process_msg method.

Core::Rendering¶

Rendering routines for Hardtree

Returns source of the template file

maker.core.rendering.render_string_template(template_string, context={}, context_instance=None)[source]¶

Performs rendering using template_string instead of a file, and context. context_instance is only used to feed user into context (unless already defined)

Returns string.

maker.core.rendering.render_to_ajax(template_name, context={}, context_instance=None)[source]¶

Render request into JSON object to be handled by AJAX on the server-side

Extended render_to_response to support different formats

Picks up the appropriate template to render to string
